name: frost at dawn cowl
sizes_available: sport (worsted) 21 (24)” [53.5 (61) cm] circumference by 12 (15)” [30.5 (38) cm] deep at point
notes:
farm yarns are my jam. my friend hannah from mindful folk farm lovingly raises her sheep to create small batch, botanically hand dyed yarns. this project was designed as a two-skein project to make the most of her gorgeous yarns. this unisex cowl is deep, featuring a simple stitch pattern to show off subtle color variations. a point at the bottom creates a “kerchief” look, and includes an optional tassel. you can find mindful folk fiber here: [https://www.etsy.com/shop/mindfulfolk][1] 

while the larger worsted weight pink version uses mindful folk yarn, the smaller sport weight green version features another very special yarn: cashmere people cashgora sport. it uses only one skein of this incredible soft, hand spun and hand dyed yarn. this yarn has a very special story as it is ethically sourced, spun and dyed by women in tajikistan and afghanistan.  you can find cashmere people yarns here: [https://portfiber.com/collections/tajik-cashgora-yarn][2]

**please note, this free pattern is my gift to you. pattern support, including but not limited to yarn substitutions, advice on techniques, and pattern modifications, will not be available.**

**finished measurements**
sport (worsted)
21 (24)” [53.5 (61) cm] circumference by 12 (15)” [30.5 (38) cm] deep at point (adjustable size)

**yarn**
sport weight (shown in green): cashmere people yarns cashgora sport (100% cashgora; 296 yds [271 meters] / 100 grams); 1 skein in pine.
worsted weight (shown in pink): mindful folk fiber phinela (60% finn wool, 40% mohair; 180 yds / 70 grams); 2 skeins (yarn in photos is dyed with a combination of coreopsis & cochineal).

**needles**
sport: 16” [40 cm] circular needle in size us 4 [3.5 mm]
worsted: 24” [60 cm] circular needle or smaller in size us 6 [4 mm]
or size needed to obtain gauge

**gauge**
sport: 22 sts and 32 rnds = 4” [10 cm] in ridge pattern, after blocking
worsted: 18 sts and 30 rnds = 4” [10 cm] in ridge pattern, after blocking

**notions**
2 stitch markers



  [1]: https://www.etsy.com/shop/mindfulfolk
  [2]: https://portfiber.com/collections/tajik-cashgora-yarn
